CatDescriptText: J. D. Northcutt, 7704 Hermitage Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 2, 1957, pg. 2, with question: "Do you believe that one political party should be in control of all the offices in city, county, and state?" answer reads: "No, I don't believe so. In some way, there should be a minority party representation."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of smiling J.D. Northcutt wearing houndstooth jacket, plaid shirt, eyeglasses, and fedora, posed in front of textured block column
